job_title: Student Employment Assistant in Pewaukee, WI
pros: This is a great place to work!
cons: There are no cons working here.

pros: Autonomy. There Nothing else positive.
cons: You will work 60+ hours a week while other faculty have no responsibility. There is no accountability. You are Paid for 1500 hours a year and will work 2500.

pros: People, Benefits, Pay, Balance, View within community
cons: Communication, Silo's, Flexibility, Training,Professional Development

pros: Lax on uniforms. I could wear my Converse, jeans, and nice shirts. They didn't care if I showed up at 6:00am or 6:05am. The building I worked in was nice, too, since it had just been rebuilt over this past summer. No weekends, and I met some cool people whom I could tease (gently!) about not getting coffee when they came over for food.
cons:
HAIRNETS! UGH! I'm sorry, but they made me feel like a grumpy old lunch lady when I wore them. 

DISORGANIZATION GALORE! The cafe is new, so rules change all the time, which is annoying. There were no aprons, STILL, for me and my coworker by the time I was fired (6 weeks!). Signs for the menu took WAY too long to come in, and I was always made to cashier, as if my coworker couldn't stop slicing up chicken or carrots for whatever she was making, EVER.

Poor communication skills, and they don't give you chances to improve if you do something wrong. You just get barked at or talked to a few times, then boom, you get fired. Messy! Not worth accepting an offer!

pros: Great place to work as instructor!
cons: I have no cons for this employer.

job_title: Part Time Instructor in Pewaukee, WI
pros: It was very rewarding to work with students that really wanted to be there and grow and achieve their goals. It was also wonderful to work with the other competent and dedicated faculty in the department.
cons: Communication amongst upper management and part time staff was unacceptable. My pay rate was reduced $9/hr with the defense from hr and senior leadership at the college telling me it was my fault for not getting an email sent a year earlier. With multiple required Inservices transporting, there was ample opportunity to address the change of certification requirements that they claimed justified my reduction to a rate that was below what I was hired at five years prior. In addition, the college seems to have lost focus on producing quality graduates that have earned their degree through hard work and determination as opposed to learning how to manipulate and inimitable the system. The college has shifted their focus from quality to quality. Very sad.

review_title: Generally a good place to work, not for me
pros: Fantastic benefits, employees I've spoken to in most departments seem to enjoy the job very much. (IT is different). The pay is fairly competitive.
cons: In my particular department, there were a number of things that were not disclosed during the interview process that would have swayed me away from accepting the position, namely that my particular department offers ZERO flexibility for just about any reason in your first year. I was told beforehand that important travel arrangements would be accommodated; that turned out to be a "miscommunication", if not an outright lie. If you have such plans, get them in writing PRIOR to accepting the position. Again, it's not entirely a bad place to work, the level of respect and accommodations you're afforded depends heavily on your supervisor. Be very careful and ask lots of questions. And don't work in IT.

job_title: Instructional Computing Coordinator in Pewaukee, WI
pros: The people and purpose of WCTC gives the job meaning. Providing training and support for the workers of today and tomorrow is critical.
cons: Instruction is not setting the agenda for the direction of an educational institution.  Rather than invest in it's self leadership has opted to lay off a skilled workforce.

pros: The organization does a very good job matching very much limited resources with a concrete and optimistic mission statement that attempts to eradicate unemployment
cons: There are some inefficiencies but for the most part working here has been a great experience.  could make more of an effort to go green.

pros: Very supportive administration, it’s a pleasant work environment. Ability to set own hours is a plus. Students are generally very nice.
cons: Students numbers need to be high to run class. It’s hard to get enough hours for course content. Occasionally a student will be rude, but supervisors have been supportive in resolving issues.

review_title: WCTC a great place to work
pros: The ability to work with knowledgeable colleagues, share resources, and help students achieve their potential to be successful contributors to the workplace.
cons: As with any organization there are some challenges; however, WCTC provides opportunities for staff, faculty and administrators to work collaboratively.

pros: I work with wonderful people who truly care about the work that they do.  The environment is student-success focused.  We are constantly looking or ways to enhance the learner's experience.  Strong team dynamic.  Mission is evident in outcomes.
cons: Some fear with employees post Act 10.  Quite a bit of uncertainty--mostly self-induced.

job_title: Full Time Faculty in Huber Heights, OH
pros: Great benefits - health insurance cannot be beaten.
cons: Lack of respect for faculty; Do not value time/input; No PTO for full time faculty

review_title: I have gained a lot of great experience by working at WCTC and helping to improve the campus.
job_title: Student Work Study in Pewaukee, WI
pros: All of the staff are very friendly, helpful and go out of their way to assist me.
cons: I haven't experienced any negative situations besides the occasional punk student.

pros: Great place to work. Very fulfilling working with adult students.
cons: too many part-time employees without a voice.

pros:
Benefits were untouchable (at the time, before Act 10)
Decent pay for job requirements
cons: Internal candidates need not apply

pros: Great Benefits, great instructors, a place you can work forever
cons: Management doesn't let you make mistakes, the people who have been working there forever have a union type mentality and think they can get away with anything.

pros:
Benefits, vacation, pay is competitive for the field.
Try hard to keep up with industry needs.
cons: Like other education entities, some things can be slow to change - especially in regards to employee culture.

pros: Good pay for part time, professional employment.
cons: Adjunct faculty treated like second class citizens.

job_title: IT Support Analyst in Pewaukee, WI
pros: Location makes it easy to work
cons: Bureaucracy is pretty annoying, pay is lower than most positions with this title

pros: none so far, offer relocation fee and pay rate is ok
cons: Macro Management, lack of management, no on-board training , all is mess-up.
